text:
Martin Bruce Cameron (born 24 August 1935) is an Australian politician. As a member of the Liberal Party, he served as a Senator for South Australia from May to October 1969. He was later a member of the South Australian Legislative Council from 1971 to 1990.
Career.
During his time in the Parliament of South Australia, he served as a Liberal except from during 1973–76, when he represented the splinter Liberal Movement.
Personal life.
Cameron was born in Millicent, South Australia. In 1960, he married Barbara Hensley. The couple had five children.
